reviewText: This series is simply phenomenal.  Thank you MPI for bringing these episodes to DVD and keeping Dark Shadows alive after 40 years.  And thank you Dan Curtis for your brilliant imagination.  You'll be missed.

reviewText: I'm going to keep this pretty brief story-wise so as not to give too much away. Barnabas and Julia are unable to stop the destruction of Collinwood by the ghost of Gerard Stiles, and very few survive the destruction (Quentin and Caroline are off their rockers). Julia escapes via the stairway through time back to 1840, but Barnabas is unable to locate the stairway and resorts to the I Ching wands. There's plenty of intrigue, treachery and terror going on, a witch's coven, the return of Angelique and the very best part of all is the Head of Judah Zachary. Oh my. Don't watch the last parts of this before going to bed.That's about all you need to whet your appetite going in. John Karlan, David Selby and Nancy Barrett are at the top of their form (as always). It's fun watching Kate Jackson in her first professional role as Daphne, and there is an interview with her at the end of one of the DVD's in this set - what a class act she was and still is.
summary: Some of the best storyline to date

reviewText: Here is the next dark shadows collection 23 in the 26 collections of this great classic soap on dvd.This soap had everything from going back in time to 1796 where Victora was almost hang for being an witch and yes you go back through time again to see how Quentin became the werewolf. So if you love classic soaps like I do then this is an must for all fans young and old this is not like the soaps of today cause you don't see them in bed together hardly.Rondall Banks

reviewText: This was a good series when it was first on. It always had me sitting on the edge of my seat. In this part of the series of parallel time, much has happenned.While things got more interesting in one Collinwood, it would always follow that to continue in the present one.Between parallel time, Collinwod of the past, and, present, things would always get very interesting.The adventures never ended for Barnabas, Julia Hoffman, Willie Loomis, and, others.I would reccommend the entire series to anyone. They did an excellent job of copying it, and, I am glad they kept all the original glitches in the master tapes.William Cahill

reviewText: This series is a wonderful example of type.  The caveats are that the viewer must like the subject (vampires and other Gothic stuff)and "old" presentations.  It's nice because the language is inoffensive as are the actions of the characters (unless one is offended by the subject-matter, in which case, one isn't watching it anyway).  The story is compelling, and one is drawn to the characters.  For myself, it was the only "soap opera" I have ever watched - and I did, on a regular basis.  I felt deprived if I had to miss an episode, and I taped them all.  It is a thoroughly engaging series.
